Update version

Convert all references of 'declination' to 'azimuth' (declination
properly refers to the offset of Nm from Nt, azimuth to compass angle
in the range 0 - 360 deg)

Replace usage of 'declination' with 'azimuth' in DistoX wireless
protocol implementation.

In his documentation, Beat Heeb uses the former when describing the
data packet structure, then the latter in his example parsing code.
'Azimuth' is the most unambiguous of the two.
Initial Compass survey exporter implementation
Crudely plug Compass export in alongside Therion export

Switch 'Declination' to 'Azimuth'

Minor Tweaks
Add braces for consistency
Upon an 'about the same' triple-shot, average their values rather than arbitrarily choosing one of them.
Promote two splays to a single named shot if we recognize them as a frontsight and backlight.
